conclusion: Analyze forces at points C and D to keep rope CD horizontal.
Point C has gravitational force mg pulling down; Point D needs force F to keep CD horizontal.
Rope AC and BC exert forces T at angle θ with horizontal.
Decompose T into vertical Ty = T sin θ and horizontal Tx = T cos θ components.
For vertical equilibrium at C: 2T sin θ = mg.
For horizontal equilibrium at C: 2T cos θ = FT.
Relate T and FT: T = mg / (2 sin θ).
Substitute T in horizontal equilibrium: FT = mg cos θ / sin θ = mg cot θ.
Force F at D must counterbalance FT to keep CD horizontal: F = FT = mg cot θ.
AC = BC = L and AB = 2L, triangle ACB is isosceles with ∠ACB = 90°.
Simplify F using cot θ = 1: F = mg.
Minimum force at D to keep CD horizontal is mg.
